result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey A. Olson

defendant.name: Olson, Jeffrey A.
defendant.address: 2804 apt G 39th St, Two Rivers, WI 54241

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jeffrey A. Olson
Current: 2804 apt G 39th St, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 09-01-2022)
Prior: 331 N. Park Avenue, Medford, WI 54451

2:04 PM Defendant Jeffrey A. Olson appeared by video.  Attorney John P Runde in court for Jeffrey A. Olson.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. 
Attorney Tlusty moves to amend Count 1 in 21CM91 to disorderly conduct and dismiss the domestic abuse modifier. Plea agreement recited into the record. Defendant enters a plea of no contest in count 1 amended charge to disorderly conduct in 21CM91. Defendant enters a plea of no contest in count 2 of 22CM23. Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 disorderly conduct in 21CM91 remaining counts are dismissed but read in. Court finds defendant guilty of count 2 retail theft in 22CM23. Court moves to dismiss and read in remaining counts and case 22CM40. Statement made by Attorney Tlusty. Statement made by Attorney Runde. Statement made by defendant. Court withholds sentence in amended count 1 21CM91 and count 2 of 22CM23 and orders probation for 1 year with the conditions of court costs for each count, DNA sample and surcharge on each count, restitution in the amount of $23.03 in 22CM23, a letter of apology to S.O. in 21CM91 and Walmart in 22CM23 due within 30 days of sentencing to be preapproved by the probation agent, counseling as deemed appropriate by the probation agent. Court orders the costs to be made to the Taylor County Clerks office in the amount of $100 a month starting October 10, 2022.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

8:30 AM Defendant Jeffrey A. Olson appeared by video.  Attorney John P Runde appeared by video for Jeffrey A. Olson.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Parties have reached an agreement. Plea and sentencing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 2:00p.m.-JN

8:30 AM Defendant Jeffrey A. Olson appeared by video.  Attorney John P Runde appeared by video for Jeffrey A. Olson.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Parties have reached an agreement. Waives further reading of the complaint, charges and penalties. Plea of not guilty entered, Bond continued. Plea and sentencing is scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 2:00p.m.-JN
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Initial appearance on July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:22 PM Defendant Jeffrey A. Olson not in court.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant was not served with the criminal complaint.  Initial appearance will be rescheduled.
*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.

1:30 pm - Attorney Mark Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeffrey A. Olson appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Fuhr is requesting a $1,500.00 signature bond; booking.  No statement by defendant.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Fuhr.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Next scheduled court appearance is July 5, 2022 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
